title: A tale of two drunks.
content:
Who, last night at 10:00pm spun their car out of control and smashed through our fence and into our house.

Our gate ended up halfway down our driveway, their speakers ended up in our nighbours front yard and one of them ended up being pinned behind the back seat [he was origionally sitting in the front.] Despite this he was still quite cheerful when he emerged, still clutching a beer can. The first words he said were 'Y'know, I'm a coal miner, chicks dig me.'

Now our toilet doesn't work couse the peipes broken, and my gardern is in ruins!

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: A tale of two drunks.
content:
Aww... gardens grow back and houses can be fixed.

But man that does suck. I hope no one was hurt. (Physically or mentally.)

I'm wondering, what is going to happen to HIM? Is he going to have to pay for the damages? I don't know the DUI laws in NZ but in the states it is pretty severe.

And give details. I want to know what happens to those bastards.-----------------------

title: ugh
content:
Did you dig him? I mean, he was a coal miner and everything. Probably had blacklung and everything. :-)

I'm sorry to hear about that... the worst experience my family's had with drunk drivers was back when I was 4 or so. Evidently one of my neighbors got so drunk she couldn't stand and decided to go for a drive--put 'er in reverse and floored it across the street into the relatively new car parked there. What a mess.

title: Yeah...
content:

Who gives a damn about the fence, the house, or anything else, I want to hear what comes next... Levellord and the coal miner... This should be fun!

title: Re: Yeah...

Now because I'm only 14, I can't actually admit to anything, but lets just say that we now have a new fence, and of very high quality.

Oh, and I didn't want the other guy to feel lonely, I gave him your phone number, is that okay?
